Title: IT ENDS WITH US
Description: A battered wife raised in a violent home attempts to halt the cycle of abuse.

Title: VERITY
Description: Lowen Ashleigh is hired by the husband of an injured writer to complete her popular series and uncovers a horrifying truth.

Title: THE INK BLACK HEART
Description: The sixth book in the Cormoran Strike series. When a cartoonist is murdered, Cormoran and Robin go after a mysterious online figure known as Anomie.

Title: WHERE THE CRAWDADS SING
Description: In a quiet town on the North Carolina coast in 1969, a young woman who survived alone in the marsh becomes a murder suspect.

Title: CARRIE SOTO IS BACK
Description: A tennis player comes out of retirement and trains with her father to defend her record.

Title: UGLY LOVE
Description: A casual sexual relationship between Tate and Miles becomes more complicated than they expected.

Title: NOVEMBER 9
Description: Ben and Fallon meet on the same day each year but a possible untruth might spoil their relationship.

Title: THE SEVEN HUSBANDS OF EVELYN HUGO
Description: A movie icon recounts stories of her loves and career to a struggling magazine writer.

Title: LOVE ON THE BRAIN
Description: Heartbeats quicken and neurons fire when a pair of antagonistic scientists work together on a project.

Title: OTHER BIRDS
Description: When she takes over her deceased mother’s apartment, Zoey has strange encounters with her new neighbors.

Title: FIRE AND BLOOD
Description: Set 300 years before the events of “A Game of Thrones,” this is the first volume of the two-part history of the Targaryens in Westeros.

Title: THE 6:20 MAN
Description: When his ex-girlfriend turns up dead in his office building, an entry-level investment analyst delves into the halls of economic power.

Title: THE JUDGE'S LIST
Description: The second book in the Whistler series. Investigator Lacy Stoltz goes after a serial killer and closes in on a sitting judge.

Title: ALL GOOD PEOPLE HERE
Description: A journalist who returns to her hometown vows to find a missing girl and solve a 20-year-old cold case.

Title: ALL YOUR PERFECTS
Description: Quinn and Graham’s marriage depends on past promises.

Title: DAISY DARKER
Description: A family reunion on a tidal island turns deadly as the characters are isolated by a storm and killed one by one.

Title: THE HOTEL NANTUCKET
Description: The new general manager of a hotel far from its Gilded Age heyday deals with the complicated pasts of her guests and staff.

Title: LESSONS IN CHEMISTRY
Description: A scientist and single mother living in California in the 1960s becomes a star on a TV cooking show.

Title: BABEL
Description: In 1828, Robin Swift studies at Oxford University’s Royal Institute of Translation and faces a choice when Britain pursues a war with China.

Title: THE MIDNIGHT LIBRARY
Description: Nora Seed finds a library beyond the edge of the universe that contains books with multiple possibilities of the lives one could have lived.

Title: GIRL, FORGOTTEN
Description: U.S. Marshal Andrea Oliver goes to Longbill Beach to protect a judge and winds up investigating a cold case from 1982.

Title: OVERKILL
Description: A former football star falls for a state prosecutor at the same time he must decide whether to kill his ex-wife, who is on life support, to ensnare her attacker.

Title: THE CHALLENGE
Description: Parents of children who have gone missing on a dangerous peak in Montana form a search-and-rescue mission.

Title: TOMORROW, AND TOMORROW, AND TOMORROW
Description: Two friends find their partnership challenged in the world of video game design.

Title: WRONG PLACE WRONG TIME
Description: A mother who witnesses her son murder a stranger finds her days are going in reverse and seeks to use that to alter events.

Title: MAYBE SOMEDAY
Description: When a college student finds out her boyfriend is cheating on her, she turns her attention to her guitar-playing neighbor.

Title: THE SILENT PATIENT
Description: Theo Faber looks into the mystery of a famous painter who stops speaking after shooting her husband.

Title: BOOK LOVERS
Description: While on vacation in North Carolina, a literary agent keeps running into an editor.

Title: CONFESS
Description: Auburn Reed falls for an artist with a troubled past.

Title: PEOPLE WE MEET ON VACATION
Description: Opposites Poppy and Alex meet to vacation together one more time in hopes of saving their relationship.

Title: THE LOST GIRLS OF WILLOWBROOK
Description: In 1970s Staten Island, after a teenager discovers her twin sister did not die but was committed to Willowbrook State School, she is herself mistaken for the girl.

Title: EVERY SUMMER AFTER
Description: The love story of Percy and Sam is told over the course of six summers and one weekend.

Title: I'M GLAD MY MOM DIED
Description: The actress and filmmaker describes her eating disorders and difficult relationship with her mother.

Title: THE BODY KEEPS THE SCORE
Description: How trauma affects the body and mind, and innovative treatments for recovery.

Title: BREAKING HISTORY
Description: An account of time spent in the Trump White House by the former president’s son-in-law and senior adviser.

Title: CRYING IN H MART
Description: The daughter of a Korean mother and Jewish-American father, and leader of the indie rock project Japanese Breakfast, describes creating her own identity after losing her mother to cancer.

Title: DIANA, WILLIAM, AND HARRY
Description: A biography of the late Princess of Wales and her sons.

Title: EDUCATED
Description: The daughter of survivalists, who is kept out of school, educates herself enough to leave home for university.

Title: PATH LIT BY LIGHTNING
Description: The life story of the Olympic athlete, All-American football player and Major League Baseball player Jim Thorpe.

Title: FINDING ME
Description: The multiple award-winning actress describes the difficulties she encountered before claiming her sense of self and achieving professional success.

Title: BRAIDING SWEETGRASS
Description: A botanist and member of the Citizen Potawatomi Nation espouses having an understanding and appreciation of plants and animals.

Title: BORN A CRIME
Description: A memoir about growing up biracial in apartheid South Africa by the host of “The Daily Show.”

Title: AN IMMENSE WORLD
Description: The Pulitzer Prize–winning science writer explains the sensory perceptions and ways of communication used by a variety of animals.

Title: ALL ABOUT LOVE
Description: The late feminist icon explores the causes of a polarized society and the meaning of love.

Title: LIFE ON THE MISSISSIPPI
Description: The author of “The Oregon Trail” recounts his adventures on a wooden flatboat and challenges the myths of American expansion.

Title: GREENLIGHTS
Description: The Academy Award-winning actor shares snippets from the diaries he kept over 35 years.

Title: THINK AGAIN
Description: An examination of the cognitive skills of rethinking and unlearning that could be used to adapt to a rapidly changing world.

Title: WHAT HAPPENED TO YOU?
Authour: Bruce D. Perry and Oprah Winfrey
Description: An approach to dealing with trauma that shifts an essential question used to investigate it.

Title: WHAT WE OWE THE FUTURE
Description: A philosopher shares his perspective on what we should do now to ensure that civilization would rebound if it collapsed.

Title: OPERATION PINEAPPLE EXPRESS
Description: A retired Green Beret gives an account of a rescue mission during the time of America's withdrawal from Afghanistan.

Title: FROM STRENGTH TO STRENGTH
Description: A columnist for The Atlantic espouses ways to shift priorities and habits to overcome waning abilities in later life.

Title: VACUUMING IN THE NUDE
Description: Stories of vacation mishaps, writers’ conferences and a cancer support group.

Title: JUST MERCY
Description: A civil rights lawyer and MacArthur grant recipient’s memoir of his decades of work to free innocent people condemned to death.

Title: TALKING TO STRANGERS
Description: Famous examples of miscommunication serve as the backdrop to explain potential conflicts and misunderstandings.

Title: THIS IS YOUR MIND ON PLANTS
Description: A look at arbitrary beliefs surrounding opium, caffeine and mescaline, which are derived from plants.

Title: THINKING, FAST AND SLOW
Description: When we can and cannot trust our intuitions in making business and personal decisions.

Title: OUTLIERS
Description: Unexpected factors that explain why some people succeed, such as upbringing, timing and 10,000 hours of deliberate practice.

Title: THE GLASS CASTLE
Description: The author recalls how she and her siblings were constantly moved from one bleak place to another.

Title: THE DEVIL IN THE WHITE CITY
Description: A story of how an architect and a serial killer were linked by the Chicago World's Fair of 1893.

Title: THE BOMBER MAFIA
Description: A look at the key players and outcomes of precision bombing during World War II.

Title: FUZZ
Description: An exploration of disciplinary actions and preventative measures occurring at the intersection of human behavior and wildlife biology.

Title: GRIT
Description: The MacArthur Fellow argues that passion and perseverance are more important than innate talent in creating success.

Title: THE BOY, THE MOLE, THE FOX AND THE HORSE
THE SUBTLE ART OF NOT GIVING A F*CK
FEEDING LITTLES AND BEYOND
Authour: Ali Maffucci, Megan McNamee and Judy Delaware

Title: THE GOD OF THE WAY
Authour: Kathie Lee Gifford and Rabbi Jason Sobel
